title: [QUESTION] Click or touch listener for paths in svg
body: I followed [this tutorial](https://www.pshul.com/2018/02/01/xamarin-forms-interactive-svg-image-using-skiasharp-with-pan-and-zoom/) and managed successfully to load svg with pan and zoom. My svg image consists of many `<path>` elements with `data-*` attributes. I need to know which path was clicked and get their attribute, or at least just get the id attribute. Is there any way to do that?

comments.author: charlesroddie
comments.body:
SkiaSharp.Extended does have an SVG parser. https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp.Extended/blob/master/SkiaSharp.Extended.Svg/source/SkiaSharp.Extended.Svg.Shared/SKSvg.cs
You can use adapt this code to parse svgs to your own structured format which will allow you to do what you want.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: @Almis90  I would totally have a look at Svg.Skia that @FoggyFinder posted. I don't think that SkiaSharp.Extended.Svg is going to get much love anytime soon - and it doesn't support understanding the image - it just draws it out. I think Svg.Skia probably has some APIs that you would want to use.

comments.author: Almis90
comments.body: Okay thank you guys, I will go with Svg.Skia then, closing the issue.
